items.title: Suspect in Bondi Beach attack was legally licensed to own a gun
items.standfirst: The 50-year-old suspect killed by authorities at the scene of the Bondi Beach attack had the legal right to possess a firearm, police said at a news conference in New South Wales.
items.content: The 50-year-old suspect killed by authorities at the scene of the Bondi Beach attack had the legal right to possess a firearm, police said at a news conference in New South Wales.

items.title: N.Y., L.A. police bolster security during Hanukkah after Sydney attack
items.standfirst: The mass shooting at Bondi Beach in Sydney, Australia, prompted police in New York and Los Angeles to step up security protections for the first night of the Jewish celebration of Hanukkah on Sunday. The big picture: While there were no known threats locally, police departments in N.Y. and L.A.…

items.standfirst: Fifteen people were killed and dozens injured in the attack, which targeted a Hanukkah celebration on Bondi Beach.
items.content: Fifteen people were killed and dozens injured in the attack, which targeted a Hanukkah celebration on Bondi Beach.

items.content: Sixteen people have died after an attack targeting a Hanukkah event on the beach.

items.content: At least 15 people have been killed and at least a further 42 injured in a shooting during Hanukkah celebrations.

items.title: 'Genuine hero': Bystander tackles alleged gunman during Bondi Beach mass shooting
items.standfirst: Footage captured by an eyewitness shows a man grappling with an alleged gunman during the Bondi Beach mass shooting in which at least 12 people were killed, before wrestling the weapon off him.
items.content: Footage captured by an eyewitness shows a man grappling with an alleged gunman during the Bondi Beach mass shooting in which at least 12 people were killed, before wrestling the weapon off him.

items.title: London-born rabbi and 10-year-old girl among 15 killed in Bondi terror attack
items.standfirst: A London-born rabbi and a 10-year-old girl are among 15 innocent people killed in the Bondi Beach terror attack.
items.content: A London-born rabbi and a 10-year-old girl are among 15 innocent people killed in the Bondi Beach terror attack.

items.title: Gunmen kill several at Jewish gathering in Sydney's Bondi Beach
items.standfirst: Two gunmen attacked a Hannukah celebration on a Sydney beach Sunday, killing at least 11 people in what Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese called an act of antisemitism and terrorism. The massacre at one of Australia’s most popular and iconic beaches followed a wave of antisemitic attacks that have roiled the country over the past year, although the authorities didn’t suggest those episodes and Sunday’s shooting were connected.
items.content: Two gunmen attacked a Hannukah celebration on a Sydney beach Sunday, killing at least 11 people in what Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese called an act of antisemitism and terrorism. The massacre at one of Australia’s most popular and iconic beaches followed a wave of antisemitic attacks that have roiled the country over the past year, although the authorities didn’t suggest those episodes and Sunday’s shooting were connected.

items.title: Bondi Beach shooting: Rabbi killed at Jewish holiday gathering
items.standfirst: Hundreds had gathered Sunday to celebrate a Jewish holiday at Bondi Beach where a mass shooting was carried out earlier. The event was to mark the start of the eight-day Hanukkah festival. One of the victims of the shooting was identified as Rabbi Eli Schlanger, assistant rabbi at Chabad of Bondi and a key organizer of the event, by the Orthodox Jewish movement Chabad.
items.content: Hundreds had gathered Sunday to celebrate a Jewish holiday at Bondi Beach where a mass shooting was carried out earlier. The event was to mark the start of the eight-day Hanukkah festival. One of the victims of the shooting was identified as Rabbi Eli Schlanger, assistant rabbi at Chabad of Bondi and a key organizer of the event, by the Orthodox Jewish movement Chabad.

items.title: Bondi Beach shooting: Explosive device found in vehicle linked to shooters
items.standfirst: Two gunmen shot dead at least 11 people on Sunday during a Jewish holiday celebration at Sydney’s Bondi Beach, Australian authorities said, declaring it a terrorist attack. One gunman was fatally shot by police and the second arrested. Reporting from Sydney, FRANCE 24's Richelle Harrison said police authorities claimed to have found an explosive device in a vehicle linked to one of the shooters. Harrison added that one of the suspects have been identified as Naveed Akram, who hails from southwest Sydney.
items.content: Two gunmen shot dead at least 11 people on Sunday during a Jewish holiday celebration at Sydney’s Bondi Beach, Australian authorities said, declaring it a terrorist attack. One gunman was fatally shot by police and the second arrested. Reporting from Sydney, FRANCE 24's Richelle Harrison said police authorities claimed to have found an explosive device in a vehicle linked to one of the shooters. Harrison added that one of the suspects have been identified as Naveed Akram, who hails from southwest Sydney.

items.title: Bondi Beach shooting: One suspect in custody in critical condition
items.standfirst: At least 12 people were killed and almost 30 wounded when gunmen fired on a Jewish holiday event at Sydney's Bondi Beach on Sunday in what Australian police and officials described as a terrorist attack. One suspected gunman was killed and another was in a critical condition, New South Wales Police Commissioner Mal Lanyon told a press conference. At least 29 people injured, including two police officers, were taken to hospital, he said. FRANCE 24's Richelle Harrison reports from Sydney.
items.content: At least 12 people were killed and almost 30 wounded when gunmen fired on a Jewish holiday event at Sydney's Bondi Beach on Sunday in what Australian police and officials described as a terrorist attack. One suspected gunman was killed and another was in a critical condition, New South Wales Police Commissioner Mal Lanyon told a press conference. At least 29 people injured, including two police officers, were taken to hospital, he said. FRANCE 24's Richelle Harrison reports from Sydney.

items.title: Eyewitness captures moment man tackles and disarms Bondi shooter
items.standfirst: New South Wales Police say that 11 people were killed, plus one gunman, in a shooting at Bondi Beach targeting the Jewish community.
items.content: New South Wales Police say that 11 people were killed, plus one gunman, in a shooting at Bondi Beach targeting the Jewish community.

items.title: Bondi Beach shooting a 'terrorist incident', New South Wales police force commissioner says
items.standfirst: New South Wales Police Force Commissioner Mal Lanyon said on Sunday that the Bondi Beach shooting was a “terrorist incident”. At least 12 people were killed and 29 wounded in the attack earlier in the day, he told a press conference.
items.content: New South Wales Police Force Commissioner Mal Lanyon said on Sunday that the Bondi Beach shooting was a “terrorist incident”. At least 12 people were killed and 29 wounded in the attack earlier in the day, he told a press conference.

items.title: At least 15 killed in mass shooting at Hanukkah event on Sydney's Bondi Beach
items.standfirst: Hundreds had gathered for an event at Bondi Beach called Chanukah by the Sea, which was celebrating the start of the Hanukkah Jewish festival.
items.content: Hundreds had gathered for an event at Bondi Beach called Chanukah by the Sea, which was celebrating the start of the Hanukkah Jewish festival.(Image credit: George Chan)

items.title: What we know so far about mass shooting at Bondi Beach
items.standfirst: At least 16 people have been killed, including a 10-year-old girl, after a mass shooting at Bondi Beach in Sydney.
items.content: At least 16 people have been killed, including a 10-year-old girl, after a mass shooting at Bondi Beach in Sydney.

items.title: At least 15 killed in terror attack on Jewish community at Bondi Beach

items.title: Jimmy Lai verdict: Hong Kong pro-democracy figure convicted of national security offences
items.standfirst: Verdicts on foreign collusion and sedition charges were city’s most closely watched rulings in decadesJimmy Lai verdict – liveJimmy Lai, the Hong Kong pro-democracy media tycoon, is facing life in prison after being found guilty of national security and sedition offences, in one of the most closely watched rulings since the city’s return to Chinese rule in 1997.The 78-year-old has been in jail since late 2020 on remand and serving several protest-related sentences totalling almost 10 years. Monday’s conviction, in which judges called him a “mastermind” of conspiracies designed to destabilise the Chinese government, could see him given an extra life sentence. Continue reading...
items.content: Verdicts on foreign collusion and sedition charges were city’s most closely watched rulings in decadesJimmy Lai verdict – liveJimmy Lai, the Hong Kong pro-democracy media tycoon, is facing life in prison after being found guilty of national security and sedition offences, in one of the most closely watched rulings since the city’s return to Chinese rule in 1997.The 78-year-old has been in jail since late 2020 on remand and serving several protest-related sentences totalling almost 10 years. Monday’s conviction, in which judges called him a “mastermind” of conspiracies designed to destabilise the Chinese government, could see him given an extra life sentence. Continue reading...

items.title: Hong Kong court finds media tycoon Jimmy Lai guilty in national security trial
items.standfirst: Hong Kong’s High Court on Monday convicted jailed media tycoon and pro-democracy campaigner Jimmy Lai of national security offences that could see him sentenced to life in prison, a verdict that has intensified global scrutiny of the city’s judicial independence amid a sweeping crackdown on dissent.
items.content: Hong Kong’s High Court on Monday convicted jailed media tycoon and pro-democracy campaigner Jimmy Lai of national security offences that could see him sentenced to life in prison, a verdict that has intensified global scrutiny of the city’s judicial independence amid a sweeping crackdown on dissent.

items.title: Person of interest detained in Brown University shooting that left two dead
items.standfirst: Nine others injured in Saturday attack that occurred during finals in engineering building in Providence, Rhode IslandA person of interest in the shooting that killed two people and wounded nine others at Brown University in Providence, Rhode Island, on Saturday has been detained, police have said.Col Oscar Perez – the Providence police force’s chief – confirmed at a news conference on Sunday that the person of interest was in their 20s. Perez did not provide many other details about the person, including whether that person was connected to Brown. Continue reading...

items.title: Conservative hardliner wins Chile’s presidency in election landslide
items.standfirst: José Antonio Kast will be country’s most rightwing president in 35 years of democracy
items.content: José Antonio Kast will be country’s most rightwing president in 35 years of democracy

items.title: Donald Trump’s Influence Is Redrawing Latin America’s Map to the Right
items.standfirst: José Antonio Kast won Chile’s presidential election, with experts citing growing Trump influence in Latin America as a key factor.
items.content: José Antonio Kast won Chile’s presidential election, with experts citing growing Trump influence in Latin America as a key factor.

items.title: Chile shifts sharply right as José Antonio Kast wins Presidency
items.standfirst: José Antonio Kast, a far-right politician, who has praised Chile's dictatorship, has won the presidency, signaling a sharp rightward shift fueled by fears over crime, migration, and the economy.
items.content: José Antonio Kast, a far-right politician, who has praised Chile's dictatorship, has won the presidency, signaling a sharp rightward shift fueled by fears over crime, migration, and the economy.(Image credit: Matias Delacroix)

items.title: Chile elects far-right José Antonio Kast as next president
items.standfirst: Many believe Kast will be the most right-wing president since Augusto Pinochet, who oversaw a 17-year dictatorship in Chile from 1973.
items.content: Many believe Kast will be the most right-wing president since Augusto Pinochet, who oversaw a 17-year dictatorship in Chile from 1973.

items.title: Ultra-conservative wins Chile election, will be most right-wing president since dictatorship
items.standfirst: José Antonio Kast secured a thumping victory in Chile’s presidential runoff election Sunday, defeating the candidate of the leftist governing coalition and setting the stage for the country’s most right-wing government in 35 years of democracy.
items.content: José Antonio Kast secured a thumping victory in Chile’s presidential runoff election Sunday, defeating the candidate of the leftist governing coalition and setting the stage for the country’s most right-wing government in 35 years of democracy.

items.title: Conservative hardliner wins Chile’s presidential election in landslide
items.standfirst: José Antonio Kast will be country’s most rightwing president in 35 years of democracy
items.content: José Antonio Kast will be country’s most rightwing president in 35 years of democracy

items.title: Hard-right candidate Jose Antonio Kast wins Chile presidential election
items.standfirst: Chilean voters elected the most right-wing president in 35 years of democracy on Sunday, as official results showed Jose Antonio Kast with a thumping 58 percent of votes and his rival conceding defeat. With more than ten million votes counted -- almost 70 percent of the total -- Kast had an unassailable lead over Jeannette Jara, a Communist Party member heading a broad leftist coalition.
items.content: Chilean voters elected the most right-wing president in 35 years of democracy on Sunday, as official results showed Jose Antonio Kast with a thumping 58 percent of votes and his rival conceding defeat. With more than ten million votes counted -- almost 70 percent of the total -- Kast had an unassailable lead over Jeannette Jara, a Communist Party member heading a broad leftist coalition.

items.title: Far-right candidate Jose Antonio Kast wins Chile’s presidential election
items.standfirst: Kast's victory is seen as part of a trend of right-wing victories across Latin America, including in Argentina.
items.content: Kast's victory is seen as part of a trend of right-wing victories across Latin America, including in Argentina.

items.title: Chilean election could deliver its most right-wing leader since Pinochet's dictatorship
items.standfirst: SANTIAGO, Chile — As Chileans vote on Sunday, even detractors of ultra-conservative former lawmaker José Antonio Kast say the candidate whose radical ideas lost him the past two elections is likely to become the country’s next leader
items.content: SANTIAGO, Chile — As Chileans vote on Sunday, even detractors of ultra-conservative former lawmaker José Antonio Kast say the candidate whose radical ideas lost him the past two elections is likely to become the country’s next leader

items.title: Far right eyes comeback as Chile holds presidential election
items.standfirst: Chileans began voting for a new president Sunday, making a stark choice between the most right-wing candidate in 35 years of democracy and the head of a leftist coalition. Polls show far-right candidate Jose Antonio Kast as the strong front-runner in the runoff vote against his rival Jeannette Jara, a longstanding member of the Communist Party.
items.content: Chileans began voting for a new president Sunday, making a stark choice between the most right-wing candidate in 35 years of democracy and the head of a leftist coalition. Polls show far-right candidate Jose Antonio Kast as the strong front-runner in the runoff vote against his rival Jeannette Jara, a longstanding member of the Communist Party.

items.title: Far-right candidate Kast takes early lead in Chile’s presidential election
items.standfirst: Far-right opposition candidate Jose Antonio Kast takes an early lead over his centre-left rival, Jeannette Jara.
items.content: Far-right opposition candidate Jose Antonio Kast takes an early lead over his centre-left rival, Jeannette Jara.

items.title: Three Americans killed by IS gunman in Syria, US military says
items.standfirst: Two US soldiers and a civilian interpreter were killed in the attack, according to the US Central Command.
items.content: Two US soldiers and a civilian interpreter were killed in the attack, according to the US Central Command.

items.title: Syrian who killed Americans was part of security forces, interior ministry says
items.standfirst: Syria's interior ministry said Sunday the gunman who killed three Americans in the central Palmyra region the previous day was a member of the security forces who was to have been fired for extremism. Two US troops and a civilian interpreter died in what the Syrian government described as a "terrorist attack" on Saturday, while Washington said it had been carried out by an Islamic State group (IS) militant who was then killed.
items.content: Syria's interior ministry said Sunday the gunman who killed three Americans in the central Palmyra region the previous day was a member of the security forces who was to have been fired for extremism. Two US troops and a civilian interpreter died in what the Syrian government described as a "terrorist attack" on Saturday, while Washington said it had been carried out by an Islamic State group (IS) militant who was then killed.

clusters.title: Ukraine willing to drop ambitions to join Nato, Zelenskyy says
clusters.neutral_headline: Ukraine willing to drop ambitions to join Nato, Zelenskyy says

items.title: Ukraine willing to drop ambitions to join Nato, Zelenskyy says
items.standfirst: Move marks big shift for Ukraine, which has fought to join Nato as safeguard against Russian attacksVolodymyr Zelenskyy has offered to drop Ukraine’s aspirations to join the Nato military alliance, as he held five hours of talks with US envoys in Berlin on Sunday to end the war with Russia.Donald Trump’s special envoy Steve Witkoff said “a lot of progress was made” as he and the US president’s son-in-law, Jared Kushner, met Zelenskyy in the latest push to end Europe’s bloodiest conflict since the second world war – though full details were not divulged. Continue reading...
items.content: Move marks big shift for Ukraine, which has fought to join Nato as safeguard against Russian attacksVolodymyr Zelenskyy has offered to drop Ukraine’s aspirations to join the Nato military alliance, as he held five hours of talks with US envoys in Berlin on Sunday to end the war with Russia.Donald Trump’s special envoy Steve Witkoff said “a lot of progress was made” as he and the US president’s son-in-law, Jared Kushner, met Zelenskyy in the latest push to end Europe’s bloodiest conflict since the second world war – though full details were not divulged. Continue reading...

items.title: US envoys arrive in Berlin for latest round of Ukraine peace talks with Zelenskyy
items.standfirst: U.S. President Donald Trump's special envoy Steve Witkoff and son-in-law Jared Kushner will meet Ukrainian leader Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday, as Trump grows increasingly exasperated by delays.
items.content: U.S. President Donald Trump's special envoy Steve Witkoff and son-in-law Jared Kushner will meet Ukrainian leader Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday, as Trump grows increasingly exasperated by delays.(Image credit: AP)

items.title: U.S. envoy Steve Witkoff to hold talks with Zelenskyy and European leaders in Berlin
items.standfirst: United States special envoy Steve Witkoff is on his way to Berlin, Germany, to meet with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and European leaders for peace negotiations aimed at ending the war in Ukraine, a senior White House official told NBC News
items.content: United States special envoy Steve Witkoff is on his way to Berlin, Germany, to meet with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and European leaders for peace negotiations aimed at ending the war in Ukraine, a senior White House official told NBC News

items.title: Zelenskyy says willing to drop NATO membership bid ahead of peace talks
items.standfirst: The Ukrainian president says Kyiv could drop its long-held ambition of joining NATO in exchange for security guarantees.
items.content: The Ukrainian president says Kyiv could drop its long-held ambition of joining NATO in exchange for security guarantees.

items.title: Zelensky and US envoys to push on with Ukraine talks in Berlin on Monday
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky on Sunday voiced readiness to drop his country’s bid to join NATO in exchange for Western security guarantees as he held talks in Berlin with US envoys that were set to continue on Monday. The Ukrainian leader rejected the US push for ceding territory to Russia, saying he hoped Washington would back the idea of freezing the front line where it is.
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky on Sunday voiced readiness to drop his country’s bid to join NATO in exchange for Western security guarantees as he held talks in Berlin with US envoys that were set to continue on Monday. The Ukrainian leader rejected the US push for ceding territory to Russia, saying he hoped Washington would back the idea of freezing the front line where it is.

clusters.title: 'Pressure works': Belarus opposition leader Tikhanovskaya reacts to release of political prisoners
clusters.neutral_headline: Belarus releases 123 prisoners including opposition leaders after US lifts sanctions

items.title: 'Pressure works': Belarus opposition leader Tikhanovskaya reacts to release of political prisoners
items.standfirst: Svetlana Tikhanovskaya, the exiled Belarus opposition leader, spoke to FRANCE 24 about the release from jail of fellow protest leader Maria Kolesnikova and Nobel Prize winner Ales Bialiatski along with 121 other political prisoners. "Let's not forget that at least 1,200 political prisoners are still behind bars, people are still being arrested every day, families are still being terrorised and repression hasn't stopped. So, there is still a lot of work ahead of us," said the former presidential candidate who stood against Belarus strongman Alexander Lukashenko. Asked about US moves to lift sanctions on Minsk in return for the prisoners’ release, Tikhanovskaya thanked the Trump administration for its role in brokering the deal, while calling for further pressure on the Belarus government. She added: "Lukashenko released these people not because he became humane, but because he feels the pressure and he wants sanctions lifted."
items.content: Svetlana Tikhanovskaya, the exiled Belarus opposition leader, spoke to FRANCE 24 about the release from jail of fellow protest leader Maria Kolesnikova and Nobel Prize winner Ales Bialiatski along with 121 other political prisoners. "Let's not forget that at least 1,200 political prisoners are still behind bars, people are still being arrested every day, families are still being terrorised and repression hasn't stopped. So, there is still a lot of work ahead of us," said the former presidential candidate who stood against Belarus strongman Alexander Lukashenko. Asked about US moves to lift sanctions on Minsk in return for the prisoners’ release, Tikhanovskaya thanked the Trump administration for its role in brokering the deal, while calling for further pressure on the Belarus government. She added: "Lukashenko released these people not because he became humane, but because he feels the pressure and he wants sanctions lifted."

items.title: Belarus releases 123 prisoners including opposition leaders after US lifts sanctions
items.standfirst: Nobel prize winner Ales Bialiatski and opposition figure Maria Kalesnikava among those freed after US talks with Alexander LukashenkoThe Belarusian president, Alexander Lukashenko, has freed 123 prisoners, including Nobel peace prize winner Ales Bialiatski and leading opposition figure Maria Kalesnikava, after the US lifted sanctions on Belarusian potash, a key export.The announcement came after two days of talks with an envoy of the US president, Donald Trump, the latest diplomatic push since the Trump administration started talks with the autocratic leader. Continue reading...
items.content: Nobel prize winner Ales Bialiatski and opposition figure Maria Kalesnikava among those freed after US talks with Alexander LukashenkoThe Belarusian president, Alexander Lukashenko, has freed 123 prisoners, including Nobel peace prize winner Ales Bialiatski and leading opposition figure Maria Kalesnikava, after the US lifted sanctions on Belarusian potash, a key export.The announcement came after two days of talks with an envoy of the US president, Donald Trump, the latest diplomatic push since the Trump administration started talks with the autocratic leader. Continue reading...

items.title: Belarus pardons key opposition activist, among 123 prisoners, in exchange for US sanction relief
items.standfirst: Belarus has pardoned 123 prisoners, including a Nobel Peace Prize laureate and a key opposition figure who challenged the presidential elections in 2020, in exchange for US sanctions relief.
items.content: Belarus has pardoned 123 prisoners, including a Nobel Peace Prize laureate and a key opposition figure who challenged the presidential elections in 2020, in exchange for US sanctions relief.

clusters.title: Thailand destroys bridge as fighting with Cambodia over disputed region continues

items.title: Thailand destroys bridge as fighting with Cambodia over disputed region continues

items.content: Thailand has announced a curfew as fighting with Cambodia spread to more areas of a disputed border region.

items.title: Thailand denies Trump ceasefire claim as clashes with Cambodia continue at border
items.standfirst: Thai PM says military will keep fighting and Cambodia suspends border crossings as casualties riseThailand-Cambodia fighting explainedThailand’s caretaker prime minister has denied the existence of a ceasefire with Cambodia, despite Donald Trump announcing that both countries had agreed to halt fighting.As heavy clashes continued along the border between the two countries, Anutin Charnvirakul said on Saturday that Thailand had not agreed to a ceasefire with Cambodia and that its forces would continue fighting. Cambodia announced it had suspended all border crossings with Thailand. Continue reading...
items.content: Thai PM says military will keep fighting and Cambodia suspends border crossings as casualties riseThailand-Cambodia fighting explainedThailand’s caretaker prime minister has denied the existence of a ceasefire with Cambodia, despite Donald Trump announcing that both countries had agreed to halt fighting.As heavy clashes continued along the border between the two countries, Anutin Charnvirakul said on Saturday that Thailand had not agreed to a ceasefire with Cambodia and that its forces would continue fighting. Cambodia announced it had suspended all border crossings with Thailand. Continue reading...

items.title: Cambodia shuts border crossings with Thailand as fighting continues
items.standfirst: It comes despite US President Donald Trump saying both sides had agreed to a ceasefire deal.
items.content: It comes despite US President Donald Trump saying both sides had agreed to a ceasefire deal.

items.content: The strike killed Raed Saad, a senior commander in Hamas' Qassam Brigades, the Israeli military said.

items.title: Israel says its military killed Hamas commander Raed Saed in Gaza City strike
items.standfirst: If Saed is dead he would be most senior militant to be killed since October ceasefire, in attack on car that reportedly left four deadThe senior Hamas commander Raed Saedhas been killed in a strike on a car in Gaza City, the Israeli military said on Saturday.The attack killed four people and wounded at least 25 others, according to Gaza health authorities. There was no immediate confirmation from Hamas or medics that Saed was among the dead. Continue reading...

There was no immediate confirmation from Hamas or medics that Saed was among the dead. Continue reading...

items.content: A senior Hamas commander who was one of the architects of the 7 October 2023 attacks on Israel has been killed in a strike on Gaza City, according to the country’s military.

items.title: Angry fans throw chairs and bottles at Messi event in India

items.content: The Inter Miami and Argentina forward is in India for a tour, taking in events in Kolkata, Hyderabad, Mumbai and Delhi.

items.title: Lionel Messi’s India tour starts in chaos as angry fans throw seats in stadium
items.standfirst: Argentinian makes 20-minute appearance in KolkataSupporters climb fence and hurl objects from standsLionel Messi’s tour of India kicked off on a chaotic note on Saturday as fans ripped up seats and threw them towards the pitch after the Argentina and Inter Miami forward’s brief visit to the Salt Lake Stadium in Kolkata, the ANI news agency reported.Messi is in India as part of a tour during which he is scheduled to attend concerts, youth football clinics and a padel tournament, and launch charitable initiatives at events in Kolkata, Hyderabad, Mumbai and Delhi. Continue reading...
